headline: Stock Market Strategy: InCred Equities lists 21 stocks to buy this June
intro: Despite a 4% gain in benchmark indices in 2025, Indian equity markets remain volatile due to global trade tensions. InCred Equities recommends 21 stocks with an ?Add? rating, highlighting a favorable monsoon and strong GVA growth as key positives for investors.
imagecaption: Stock Market Strategy: InCred Equities lists 21 stocks to buy this June

headline: For steel companies, Q4 was an inflexion point as prices, demand firm up
intro: Firm steel prices and a decline in imports are expected to further improve the profitability of four integrated steel players JSW Steel, Tata Steel, Steel Authority of India and Jindal Steel moving ahead
imagecaption: The combined Ebitda of JSW Steel, Tata Steel, Steel Authority of India and Jindal Steel rose only marginally by 1% during the quarter. (Image: Pixabay)

headline: Tata Steel, JSW Energy to HDFC AMC: 5 stocks to trade ex-dividend today
intro: Dividend Stocks: Tata Steel, JSW Energy, HDFC AMC, Container Corporation of India and Bank of Baroda are among the five stocks that will trade ex-dividend today.
imagecaption: Dividend Stocks:  5 Stocks to trade Ex dividend today

headline: JSW Steel, Vedanta, Tata Steel and other metal stocks drop up to 2% as Trump doubles tariffs to 50%
intro: Indian metal stocks fell up to 2%, with major companies like Lloyds Metals & Energy and Vedanta facing significant losses. Global trade tensions, particularly US tariffs on steel and aluminum, are affecting market sentiment and raising concerns over future metal demand.
imagecaption: JSW Steel, Vedanta, Tata Steel and other metal stocks drop up to 2% as trade tensions resurface

headline: Dividend Stocks: Larsen & Toubro, Tata Motors, TCS, among others to trade ex-dividend next week; Full list
intro: Dividend Stocks: Companies including Larsen & Toubro, Tata Motors, Tata Steel, Nuvama Wealth Management, and Tata Consultancy Services are among others which will trade ex-dividend in the upcoming week starting Monday, 2 June 2025.
imagecaption: Dividend Stocks: Some companies are trading ex-dividend next week, while some will trade ex-bonus, and stock split issues this upcoming week.

headline: The quiet philanthropists: Premji Foundation, Tata Trusts match social spending of top Nifty companies
intro: As per the reported financials, the eponymous not-for-profit entity of billionaire Azim Premji spent  ?1,528 crore on philanthropy in 2024. That was more than twice the  ?699.31 crore spent by the Tata Trusts in the same year, according to financials filed by the entity.
imagecaption: To be sure, unlike philanthropic entities that are not bound by any regulation in terms of amounts to be spent, enterprises are mandated to spend a portion of their profits on CSR initiatives.

headline: Nifty Metal on track for best weekly rally in 4 years amid easing trade tensions
intro: Tata Steel, Adani Enterprises, Hindustan Copper, Vedanta, and Hindalco Industries have gained up to 14% so far this week as easing US-China trade tensions boost investor confidence in metal stocks. The Nifty Metal index surged 9.17%, marking its largest weekly gain since May 2021.
imagecaption: Copper Is Beating Gold. What Lies Ahead for the Bronze Metal?s Rally.
